history.title: About Casino de Montreal
history.description2: Casino de Montréal is Canada’s largest casino, located on Notre Dame Island in Montreal. Open 24/7, it offers over 3,200 slot machines and more than 120 gaming tables, including poker, blackjack, and roulette. The casino is famous for its panoramic city views, fine dining restaurants, bars, and live entertainment. Players can enjoy major jackpots like the Bad Beat Jackpot starting at CAD 250,000, along with exciting bonus programs.

customHtml.title: Canada’s Largest Casino and Entertainment Hub
customHtml.description:
Casino de Montréal is more than just a casino; it’s a premier entertainment destination located on Notre Dame Island in Parc Jean-Drapeau, just minutes from downtown Montreal. With over 3,000 slot machines, dozens of tables for poker, blackjack, and roulette, plus an ARcade zone featuring interactive games, it combines excitement and cutting-edge technology in one place.


The casino is also a culinary hotspot, offering two signature restaurants: Le Montréal, serving refined Quebec cuisine and seafood with panoramic city views, and Pavillon 67, a gourmet buffet with international flavors. Guests can enjoy vibrant nightlife at bars like Valet Bar, featuring a massive multimedia screen and live DJs, La Dame for after-work cocktails, and Le Roi, a stylish lounge with a view of the stage. In summer, Terrasse Le Jardin becomes an outdoor oasis with live music and a tropical vibe.


Entertainment goes beyond gaming with Cabaret du Casino, hosting concerts, comedy shows, and themed parties, including Halloween and New Year’s Eve celebrations. Free live music and weekend shows add to the experience. While the casino doesn’t have its own hotel, its central location ensures easy access to Montreal’s top accommodations. It’s also easily reachable by car or public transit, with shuttle and bus services from Jean-Drapeau metro station.


Players can enjoy generous bonuses, including the Bad Beat Jackpot starting at CAD 250,000, poker bonus hands up to CAD 500, and exclusive offers for high-stakes players. The Casino Privilèges loyalty program rewards frequent visitors with points redeemable for gaming credits, dining, and special events.


Casino de Montréal is the ultimate destination for gaming, fine dining, live entertainment, and nightlife in one of North America’s most vibrant cities.


Rules for visiting Casino de Montréal

Age and Identification

  • • Entry is allowed only for guests 18 years and older
  • • A valid photo ID (passport, driver’s license, or government - issued ID) is required for admission.

Hours and Accessibility

  • • Open daily: Sunday to Thursday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 AM, Friday and Saturday until 5:00 AM.
  • • Free parking and full accessibility for guests with reduced mobility.

Dress Code

  • • Recommended style: smart casual.
  • • Acceptable: neat jeans, shirts, dresses, closed-toe shoes.
  • • Not allowed: sportswear, beachwear, ripped clothing, shorts, hats, or offensive T-shirts.

Prohibited Items and Behavior

  • • Weapons, drugs, alcohol, and professional photo/video equipment are strictly prohibited without prior authorization.
  • • Personal photos are allowed only in designated areas.
  • • Smoking is permitted only in designated smoking zones.
  • • Mobile phone use is restricted to specific areas.

Security and Checks

  • • All bags and backpacks are subject to inspection at the entrance.
  • • The casino reserves the right to deny entry for rule violations.

Casino Privilèges Loyalty Program: More Play, More Rewards

Casino de Montréal offers its guests an exclusive loyalty program called Casino Privilèges, designed to make every visit more rewarding. By joining, you start earning Privilèges Points for every game you play, which can be redeemed for gaming credits, fine dining experiences, or tickets to spectacular shows.


The program features multiple status levels — from basic to Prestige Plus — and each tier unlocks greater benefits, personalized offers, and exclusive promotions. Members enjoy up to 15% discounts on food and beverages, as well as access to private events and special prize draws.


Additional perks include exclusive bonuses for high rollers, tailored promotions, and the ability to use your points at partner hotels such as Hilton Lac-Leamy and Fairmont Le Manoir Richelieu.

customHtml_2.title: Entertainment at Casino de Montreal
customHtml_2.description:
Casino de Montréal promotions and special offers

Casino de Montréal regularly delights its guests with exciting promotions, bonuses and themed events. Gambling enthusiasts can try their luck at Poker Bonus Hands with additional winnings up to 500 CAD or hit the Bad Beat Jackpot, which starts at 250,000 CAD and can exceed one million. For those who appreciate entertainment, the casino offers themed parties, concerts and shows at Cabaret du Casino, as well as free music programs on weekends. Gourmets will appreciate the gastronomic promotions, including Wine Discoveries and specialty brunches at Pavillon 67. Casino Privileges loyalty program members receive discounts of up to 15% on food and drinks, exclusive offers and access to private events. VIP packages are available for groups and corporate clients, including My Private Croupier and interactive entertainment in the ARcade area.


Regular Promotions and Events

  • • Halloween and Themed Parties — special shows and prize draws at Cabaret du Casino.
  • • Stand-up Nights — free comedy shows every Monday.
  • • Wine Discoveries — wine tastings on Mondays and Tuesdays at Le Montréal restaurant.
  • • MTLàTABLE — gourmet weeks with exclusive menus.
  • • Country Thursdays — themed nights with live music at Valet Bar.
  • • Party Mix Nights — DJ sets and dancing on Fridays and Saturdays.
  • • Sunday Brunch — signature brunch at Pavillon 67.

Gaming Promotions and Bonuses

Casino Privilèges Loyalty Program

  • • 15% discount on food and drinks from Monday to Thursday.
  • • Discounts on tickets for Cabaret du Casino.
  • • Earn points for gaming and dining.
  • • Exclusive offers for program members.

Group and VIP Offers

  • • My Private Croupier — rent a private table with a dealer for your group.
  • • ARcade for Team Building — interactive entertainment for corporate events.
  • • Coach Group Promo — special packages for tour groups with a chance to win up to CAD 10,000.
  • • Poker Bonus Hands — win up to CAD 500 for bonus hands (daily).
  • • Bad Beat Jackpot — progressive jackpot starting at CAD 250,000, which can exceed CAD 1,000,000.
  • • Poker Tournaments — held Monday through Wednesday.

Popular Casino de Montréal Games

Casino de Montréal offers an incredible variety of games — over 3,000 slot machines and more than 120 tables for classic and modern entertainment. Here are the most popular categories:


Slot Machines

The casino features thousands of slots with vibrant graphics and bonus rounds. Among the popular titles is Huff N’ Even More Puff™, which includes a progressive jackpot and exciting bonus features. Themes range from the Wild West to magical worlds. Many machines are equipped with giant curved screens and mini-games, where even a small bet can lead to big wins.


Table Games

  • • Blackjack (including Free Bet Blackjack)
  • • Roulette.
  • • Baccarat
  • • Craps
  • • Mississippi Stud Poker (with a chance to win up to 500x your bet)
  • • 3 Card Poker and War

Poker

The casino boasts Quebec’s best poker room with 18 tables for cash games and tournaments. Both limit and no-limit games are available, along with the Bad Beat Jackpot, which starts at CAD 250,000 and can exceed CAD 1,000,000.


Electronic Games

For beginners and those who love fast-paced action, there are electronic versions of roulette, blackjack, Sic Bo, poker, and craps. These allow players to enjoy an interactive experience with real rules and a user-friendly interface.

Restaurants and Bars at Casino de Montréal

Casino de Montréal offers more than just gaming — it’s also a destination for quality dining. The venue features three main restaurants and several bars, each with its own atmosphere and menu.


Le Montréal is a refined à la carte restaurant with panoramic views. It serves seafood, grilled meats, and seasonal dishes made with local ingredients. Tasting menus and wine pairings are available. The restaurant opens at 5 PM, and reservations are recommended.


Pavillon 67 is a buffet-style restaurant with an open kitchen. Guests can enjoy grilled meats, seafood, and desserts. Lunch, dinner, and Sunday brunch are available, with prices ranging from 25 to 55 CAD.


L’Instant is a deli and pasta bar offering quick bites like pasta with homemade sauces and Montréal-style smoked meat sandwiches. It’s ideal for a fast meal between games or shows and stays open late on weekends


The bar scene includes Valet Bar, known for its massive multimedia wall and live DJ sets, La Dame and Le Roi for relaxed lounge vibes, and the seasonal outdoor terrace Le Jardin, which features cocktails and live Latin music in summer.


All venues participate in the Casino Privilèges program, offering weekday discounts. Online reservations are available and recommended during peak hours and before shows.

items.title: Can you visit the casino without playing?
items.answer: Yes, you can come just to have dinner, watch a show, or enjoy a drink at the bar. Admission is free, age restriction is 18+.

items.title: Do you need to register to enter the casino?
items.answer: No, registration is not required. Entry is free, but visitors must be at least 18 years old. ID may be requested at the entrance.

items.title: Can you pay for food and drinks with a bank card?
items.answer: Yes, restaurants and bars at Casino de Montréal accept major bank cards, including Visa, Mastercard, and Interac. Cash is also accepted.

items.title: Is there Wi-Fi in the casino?
items.answer: Yes, free Wi-Fi is available throughout the casino, including restaurants and lounge areas.
